Description.Name: Kai Bai Bo
Description.Details: You start to leave your office when you run into Darius, Yang, Sumire and Dr Murad. Darius motions you back towards your office, "Commander, the live feed from Front Man of [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]'s last game is getting ready to broadcast." You turn back to your office, motioning at everyone to follow, "Put it on the screen, Darius. Ok folks, let's hope [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] makes it through the final challenge." Darius punches in some information on the terminal next to the large display screen mounted on the wall in your office, "Transmission coming in now, Commander." The black screen shimmers to life, the blurry images slowly taking focus. The image resolves into a view of [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] in a courtyard along with a number of other players. Each player has a number displayed on their shirts. Everyone is watching the screen, when Yang yells out, "C'mon [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]], you got this! ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Hidden game arena on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]]:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] stands in a courtyard with {SCN_MW.DET} fellow contestants. There are guards everywhere, their faces still covered with full masks so that no one can see their faces. A bell chimes and a voice is heard over the comms channel, "Welcome players to the next game. For this game, you will pair off into groups of two. Choose your opponent now." [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] looks around, when a big burly man walks up, PLAYER 5 stenciled on his shirt, "YOU will be my opponent." [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] looks at the man towering over {SCN_MW.OBJ}, hesitates, but sees that everyone else has teamed up already. {SCN_MW.SUBJ_C} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:shrug|Default:shrugs} and nods {SCN_MW.DET} agreement. The speaker activates and the voice continues, "Now that all players are paired up, we can begin. The name of today's game is Kai Bai Bo. ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Back on the ARGO:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: Yang snarls, "What the hell is Kai bye baby or whatever they called it?" Dr Murad speaks up, "It was an old child's game from Terra. It was used to settle disputes by children and in some countries, was also used by adults." Sumire enquires, "Do you know the rules?" Dr Murad nods, "Yes, I have played this as a child, more as a fun competition than to settle any disagreements. Where I grew up, we called it 'Rock, Paper, Scissors. The principle is quite simple, you would face your opponent, and both count to three while shaking your closed hand in front of each other. On the final 3, you would quickly resolve your hand into one of they poses: A closed fist, ROCK; an open palm, PAPER or your two fingers extended in a V with the rest tucked in: SCISSORS. The winner is determined by the strongest hand." Yang interupts, "Well that is a stupid game, rock wins every time!" Dr Murad shakes her head, "No, Yang, it does not. The strength of each is as follows: ROCK breaks SCISSORS, SCISSORS cuts PAPER and PAPER covers ROCK." You mull this over, "So [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] needs to pick someone whom {SCN_MW.SUBJ} can either outsmart or intimidate into picking a weaker hand?" Darius looks on skeptically, "I don't know Commander, I think this is just another random game of pure chance." ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Hidden game arena on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]]:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: The voice continues, "You and your opponent will extend one closed hand in front of each other. Count to three and form your and into the shape of a ROCK by keeping your fist closed. Form the shape of PAPER by extending your hand out flat. Form SCISSORS by extending your two fingers out in a V and tucking the others into your palm. Rock beats Scissors, which beats Paper, which beats Rock. The winners will face off against each other until only one winner is left. That person will win be crowned 'Champion'. Refusing to play will result in the player opting to forfeit. The game begins... NOW!" [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] stares into the eyes of PLAYER 5. They put their hands out before them and count: ONE... TWO... THREE... [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] forms {SCN_MW.DET} hand into ROCK while PLAYER 5 forms SCISSORS. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] smiles coldly, "Looks like I win." PLAYER 5 growls and starts to lunge for [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] when a guard walks up and shoots PLAYER 5 in the chest, killing him instantly. The voice sounds, "PLAYER 203 wins. Find another player and continue." [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] finds another player and wins again. {SCN_MW.SUBJ_C} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:continue|Default:continues} for 5 more 'rounds' before it is down to one final opponent, a tall, skinny monk-like man with oversized thick glasses and PLAYER 99 on his shirt. As [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] approaches, PLAYER 99 extends his hand and says, "May good fortunes shine upon us today." [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] shakes their hand, "Good luck to you too." They square off against each other counting: ONE... TWO... THREE... [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] forms {SCN_MW.DET} hand into ROCK at the same time as PLAYER 99 forms ROCK as well. PLAYER 99 bows and starts counting again: ONE... TWO... THREE... [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] forms {SCN_MW.DET} hand into SCISSORS and PLAYER 99 also chooses SCISSORS. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] looks on calmly as PLAYER 99 smiles back. They both begin again. ONE... TWO... THREE... [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] chooses PAPER. PLAYER 99 forms his hand into PAPER. Yet another tie. PLAYER 99 chuckles, "Oh ho ho, aren't you a clever one! A worthy opponent indeed." You both start counting again: ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Back on the ARGO:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: Darius yells out to the screen, "Choose Paper!" Yang looks at Darius, "You're an idiot! Clearly Rock is the best choice." Sumire smiles, "I myself would go with Scissors at this point. What would you choose Dr Murad?" Dr Murad ponders the options before responding, "I think I will abstain. I do not wish to jinx things." ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Hidden game arena on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]]:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: ONE... TWO... THREE... [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] forms {SCN_MW.DET} hand into...

Description.Name: WE HAVE A WINNER!
Description.Details: ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Hidden game arena on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]]:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: At the count of THREE, [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] throws {SCN_MW.DET} hand out in the shape of ROCK. {SCN_MW.SUBJ_C} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:look|Default:looks} at PLAYER 99's hand, and sees SCISSORS. Relief floods through {SCN_MW.OBJ} and {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:tense|Default:tenses} as {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:look|Default:looks} up into PLAYER 99's eyes expecting to see anger. Instead, {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:are|Default:is} greeted with a warm smile. A chuckle issues from PLAYER 99, "You are a very good player! I am honoured to have been defeated by you." PLAYER 99 executes a formal bow. The guard walks over, raising their pistol and PLAYER 99 nods and addresses the guard, "If we may conduct the rest of our business elsewhere, and spare the 'Champion' any further pain, it would be appreciated." Without waiting for an answer, PLAYER 99 turns to walk towards the only exit from the courtyard. "PLAYER 99, ELIMINATED. PLAYER 203, YOU HAVE WON THE FINAL GAME." Tears of joy stream down {SCN_MW.DET} face as reality sinks in that {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:have|Default:has} won! ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Back on the ARGO:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: You and the rest of the bridge crew shout out in unison, "{SCN_MW.SUBJ_C} did it!" Barely able to contain the smiles on their faces, everyone watches the events continuing to unfold on the screen. ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Hidden game arena on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]]:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: The door behind [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] opens and a tall figure in golden robes strolls towards {SCN_MW.OBJ}. Front Man extends his hand to [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]], "Well done! Well done indeed!" [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] looks skeptically at Front Man,"Is this sick contest over?" Front Man smiles, "Why of course! Your debt has been fully paid. In fact, the Syndicate has made quit a bit of money off betting on your win. So much so that they are sending a prize package back with you to take to your Commander." Front Man still has his hand out in front of him. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] looks down at it and reluctantly shakes his hand, "Get me out of this hell hole!" ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Back on the ARGO:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: The screen fades out, and is replaced with a SIGNAL TERMINATED notice. Everyone is standing and cheering, elated that [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] has won and is coming home. You turn to Darius, "Let the crew know that [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] has won and is coming home soon." Darius nods, "Certainly Commander." A PING alert sounds on the comm panel at your desk. You move over to it and see an automated text message. It appears to be from Front Man. You click OPEN to read the message: Happy Days Commander {Commander.Lastname}! I trust you saw the recent holovid of [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] winning the final round and being crowned 'Champion'? Know that {SCN_MW.DET} debt is now paid in full, and there will be no further reparations needed on {SCN_MW.DET} behalf. As Champion, [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] has earned a reward for participating. The dropship arriving soon with [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] will contain a cargo crate. I do hope you find the items therein usable and of value. It has been an honour having [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] participate and we hope that {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:accept|Default:accepts} a future invitation to defend {SCN_MW.DET} crown. We will be in touch, Commander. Regards, Front Man Yang looks at you, "Are you serious? They want {SCN_MW.OBJ} to play again?" You rub your temples, a headache forming, "Yang, I for one will be happy to never set eyes on this Front Man ever again. If [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] wants to go off and play again, we cannot stop {SCN_MW.OBJ}." Yang still looks angry, "Well, that is a fool's errand. In any case, shall I go and see to this crate that is arriving?" You nod and dismiss Yang, then head over towards Darius and the others, "C'mon, let's go give [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] a proper welcome home!"

Description.Name: GAME OVER
Description.Details: ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Hidden game arena on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]]:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: At the count of THREE, [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] throws his hand out in the shape of ROCK. {SCN_MW.SUBJ_C} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:look|Default:looks} at PLAYER 99's hand, and sees PAPER. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]'s hand trembles and {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:look|Default:looks} up at PLAYER 99's face. Expecting to see relief, {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:are|Default:is} instead surprised to see PLAYER 99 shaking his head in disappointment. PLAYER 99 looks at [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]], "Ah, it is a shame. I had truly hoped you would win and take my place as Champion." As the guard walks over PLAYER 99 addresses the guard, "{SCN_MW.SUBJ_C} deserves respect and honour." Without waiting for an answer, PLAYER 99 turns to walk towards the only exit from the courtyard. The guard holster his blaster, and pulls out a canister from his utility belt. He then sprays a small blast of mist into [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]'s face. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]], startled by this, inhales deeply, {SCN_MW.DET} eyes flutter and {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:collapse|Default:collapses} to the ground. The guard leans down, checks for a pulse, then waves to two orderlies standing on the far side of the courtyard to come over. "PLAYER 203, ELIMINATED." ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Back on the ARGO:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: The screen fades out, and is replaced with a SIGNAL TERMINATED notice. You stare in disbelief at the screen, mouth open. Darius' shout breaks your trance, "Noooo!" Yang, in anger, throws his glass of Timbiqi Dry against the wall while Sumire and Dr Murad hug each other, tears streaming down their faces. A PING alert sounds on the comm panel at your desk. You move over to it and see an automated text message. It appears to be from Front Man. You click OPEN to read the message: My condolences, Commander {Commander.Lastname}. Since you are reading this message, it means that [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] did not survive the final round of the game. Know that {SCN_MW.DET} debt is now paid in full, and there will be no further reparations needed on {SCN_MW.OBJ} behalf. In fact, we will be giving you and your crew, a consolation prize. When [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] left on our dropship, we left behind a crate. You will find it magnetically attached to your hull outside the docking collar we used to pick up [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]. It is a shame the game did not go the full term, we could have made so much more money and your prize would have been that much greater. Regards, Front Man You look up from the screen and Darius looks at you, "Commander, it appears that these games were purely chance, with almost no skill involved. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]'s chances of surviving were not that good, I think." Yang snarls at Darius, "State the obvious, why don't you." You lean back in your chair, exhausted from the watching the ordeal that [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] went through, "Advise the crew, they need to know that [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] is not returning to us. We need to get past this and get on get on with our jobs." As everyone leaves, you cannot help but wonder if your path will cross Front Man's again.

You rub your temples, a headache forming, "Yang, I for one will be happy to never set eyes on this Front Man ever again. If [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] wants to go off and play again, we cannot stop {SCN_MW.OBJ}." Yang still looks angry, "Well, that is a fool's errand. In any case, shall I go and see to this crate that is arriving?" You nod and dismiss Yang, then head over towards Darius and the others, "C'mon, let's go give [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] a proper welcome home!"

Description.Name: GAME OVER
Description.Details: ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Hidden game arena on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]]:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: At the count of THREE, [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] throws his hand out in the shape of PAPER. {SCN_MW.SUBJ_C} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:look|Default:looks} at PLAYER 99's hand, and sees SCISSORS. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]'s hand trembles and {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:look|Default:looks} up at PLAYER 99's face. Expecting to see relief, {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:are|Default:is} instead surprised to see PLAYER 99 shaking his head in disappointment. PLAYER 99 looks at [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]], "Ah, it is a shame. I had truly hoped you would win and take my place as Champion." As the guard walks over PLAYER 99 addresses the guard, "{SCN_MW.SUBJ_C} deserves respect and honour." Without waiting for an answer, PLAYER 99 turns to walk towards the only exit from the courtyard. The guard holster his blaster, and pulls out a canister from his utility belt. He then sprays a small blast of mist into [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]'s face. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]], startled by this, inhales deeply, {SCN_MW.DET} eyes flutter and {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:collapse|Default:collapses} to the ground. The guard leans down, checks for a pulse, then waves to two orderlies standing on the far side of the courtyard to come over. "PLAYER 203, ELIMINATED." ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::Back on the ARGO:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: The screen fades out, and is replaced with a SIGNAL TERMINATED notice. You stare in disbelief at the screen, mouth open. Darius' shout breaks your trance, "Noooo!" Yang, in anger, throws his glass of Timbiqi Dry against the wall while Sumire and Dr Murad hug each other, tears streaming down their faces. A PING alert sounds on the comm panel at your desk. You move over to it and see an automated text message. It appears to be from Front Man. You click OPEN to read the message: My condolences, Commander {Commander.Lastname}. Since you are reading this message, it means that [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] did not survive the final round of the game. Know that {SCN_MW.DET} debt is now paid in full, and there will be no further reparations needed on {SCN_MW.OBJ} behalf. In fact, we will be giving you and your crew, a consolation prize. When [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] left on our dropship, we left behind a crate. You will find it magnetically attached to your hull outside the docking collar we used to pick up [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]. It is a shame the game did not go the full term, we could have made so much more money and your prize would have been that much greater. Regards, Front Man You look up from the screen and Darius looks at you, "Commander, it appears that these games were purely chance, with almost no skill involved. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]'s chances of surviving were not that good, I think." Yang snarls at Darius, "State the obvious, why don't you." You lean back in your chair, exhausted from the watching the ordeal that [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] went through, "Advise the crew, they need to know that [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] is not returning to us. We need to get past this and get on get on with our jobs." As everyone leaves, you cannot help but wonder if your path will cross Front Man's again.
